summary: This is an email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York to an appeals attorney, seeking guidance on a question that arose during the review of ESI (Electronically Stored Information) in the Epstein investigation. The email was prompted by a request from the PC (likely 'Principal' or 'Prosecuting' Chiefs).

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, an AUSA in the SDNY, who is requesting a meeting to discuss a question about ESI review in the Epstein case.

connections.person1: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
connections.description: The AUSA is contacting the appeals attorney ('M') to seek legal guidance on a matter related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Email Request for Legal Guidance
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails an appeals attorney to schedule a meeting to discuss a question that arose during the review of ESI in the Epstein investigation.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an email dated March 10, 2020, from an SDNY AUSA seeking legal guidance on the Epstein investigation.
The guidance is needed for a question that arose during the review of ESI (Electronically Stored Information).
The request was prompted by the 'PC chiefs' (likely Principal or Prosecuting Chiefs).
The correspondence indicates ongoing investigative or prosecutorial work related to the Epstein case in early 2020.
